alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 9:52AM EST until November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville and Laurens. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 952 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding along the I-385 corridor, which includes areas from Lake Rabon through the Golden Strip, north to Taylors and Greer. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Laurens, Greenville Eastside, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Gray Court, GSP Airport, Paris Mountain State Park and Hickory Tavern. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
